alert.note: Alert for Merced - Madera - Mendota (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 3:46PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Madera and central Merced Counties through 415 PM PDT... At 346 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 11 miles north of South Dos Palos, or 13 miles southwest of Merced, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Merced. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
